text: The Shiba Inu is a breed of dog from Japan. It looks like a smaller version of the Akita Inu, and was originally bred for hunting. Shiba Inu is one of seven Japanese dog species recognised as symbols of the country. There are two variations of the species. Aka-Shiba has red hair, and Kuro-Shiba has black hair. Shiba are popular among breeders in Japan. Shiba Inu are faithful to their owners but are wary of strangers. They are popular as guard dogs. The breed became famous worldwide due to an internet meme called Doge. ==Other Japanese dogs== * Akita Inu * Kai Inu also called the Kai Ken * Kisyu Inu * Tosa Inu * Hokkaido Inu * Koshi-no-inu (extinct since 1971) Category:Dog breeds originating in Japan Category:FCI breeds
title: Shiba Inu
